test_rationale: Security audit activities are independent

test_rationale: No single person is able to access, modify, or use information systems without authorization or detection

test_desc: The organization formally addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance for  configuration management
test_rationale: The organization formally addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance for  configuration management

test_desc: The organization has developed, documented, and implemented a configuration management plan for the information system
test_rationale: The organization has developed, documented, and implemented a configuration management plan for the information system

test_desc: Changes are formally controlled, documented and enforced in order to minimize the corruption of information systems
test_rationale: Changes are formally controlled, documented and enforced in order to minimize the corruption of information systems

test_rationale: Installation checklists and vulnerability scans are used to validate the configuration of servers, workstations, devices and appliances and ensure the configuration meets minimum standards

test_desc: Change control procedures to address security are included in the contract(s) where development is outsourced
test_rationale: Where development is outsourced, change control procedures to address security are included in the contract(s) and specifically require the developer to track security flaws and flaw resolution within the system, component, or service and report findings to organization-defined personnel or roles.

test_desc: The organization does not use automated updates on critical systems
test_rationale: The organization does not use automated updates on critical systems

test_desc: The organization develops, documents, and maintains, under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the information system, and reviews and updates the baseline as required
test_rationale: The organization develops, documents, and maintains, under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the information system, and reviews and updates the baseline as required

test_desc: Establishing and documenting the mandatory configuration settings for information technology products
test_rationale: The organization (i) establishes and documents mandatory configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system using the latest security configuration baselines; (ii) identifies, documents, and approves exceptions from the mandatory established configuration settings for individual components based on explicit operational requirements; and (iii) monitors and controls changes to the configuration settings in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.

test_desc: Automated mechanisms to centrally manage and verify configuration settings
test_rationale: The organization employs automated mechanisms to (i) centrally manage, apply, and verify configuration settings; (ii) respond to unauthorized changes to network and system security-related configuration settings; and (iii) enforce access restrictions and auditing of the enforcement actions.

test_desc: The organization's security gateways (e.g. firewalls) enforce security policies and are configured to filter traffic between domains
test_rationale: The organization's security gateways (e.g. firewalls) enforce security policies and are configured to filter traffic between domains, block unauthorized access, and are used to maintain segregation between internal wired, internal wireless, and external network segments (e.g., the Internet) including DMZs and enforce access control policies for each of the domains.

test_desc: The organizations network is logically and physically segmented with a defined security perimeter and a graduated set of controls
test_rationale: The organizations network is logically and physically segmented with a defined security perimeter and a graduated set of controls, including subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are logically separated from the internal network, based on organizational requirements; and traffic is controlled based on functionality required and classification of the data/systems based on a risk assessment and their respective security requirements.

test_desc: Networks are segregated from production-level networks when migrating physical servers, applications or data to virtualized servers
test_rationale: Networks are segregated from production-level networks when migrating physical servers, applications or data to virtualized servers

test_desc: Cloud service providers use an industry-recognized virtualization platform and standard virtualization formats
test_rationale: Cloud service providers use an industry-recognized virtualization platform and standard virtualization formats (e.g., Open Virtualization Format, OVF) to help ensure interoperability, and has documented custom changes made to any hypervisor in use and all solution-specific virtualization hooks available for customer review.

test_desc: Cryptography is used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions to the internal network and to external systems
test_rationale: Cryptography is used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions to the internal network and to external systems

test_desc: The organization limits the use of organization-controlled portable storage media by authorized individuals on external information systems
test_rationale: The organization limits the use of organization-controlled portable storage media by authorized individuals on external information systems

test_desc: Strong cryptography protocols are used to safeguard covered information during transmission over less trusted / open public networks
test_rationale: Strong cryptography protocols are used to safeguard covered information during transmission over less trusted / open public networks

test_desc: The organization ensures that communication protection requirements, including the security of exchanges of information, is the subject of policy development and compliance audits
test_rationale: The organization ensures that communication protection requirements, including the security of exchanges of information, is the subject of policy development and compliance audits

test_desc: Personnel are appropriately trained on leading principles and practices for all types of information exchange (oral, paper and electronic)
test_rationale: Personnel are appropriately trained on leading principles and practices for all types of information exchange (oral, paper and electronic)

test_rationale: The information system prohibits remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provides an explicit indication of use to users physically present at the devices

test_rationale: Cloud service providers use secure (e.g., non-clear text and authenticated) standardized network protocols for the import and export of data and to manage the service, and make available a document to consumers (tenants) detailing the relevant interoperability and portability standards that are involved.

test_rationale: Remote (external) access to the organization's information assets and access to external information assets (for which the organization has no control) is based on clearly defined terms and conditions

test_rationale: The organization establishes terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationship established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to (i) access the information system from external information systems; and (ii) process, store or transmit organization-controlled information using external information systems.

test_desc: The organization requires that electronic signatures, unique to one individual, cannot be reused by, or reassigned to, anyone else
test_rationale: The organization requires that electronic signatures, unique to one individual, cannot be reused by, or reassigned to, anyone else

test_desc: The information system employs replay-resistant authentication mechanisms
test_rationale: The information system employs replay-resistant authentication mechanisms such as nonce, one-time passwords, or time stamps to secure network access for privileged accounts; and, for hardware token-based authentication, employs mechanisms that satisfy minimum token requirements discussed in NIST SP 800-63-2, Electronic Authentication Guideline.

test_desc: Where tokens are provided for multi-factor authentication, in-person verification is required prior to granting access
test_rationale: Where tokens are provided for multi-factor authentication, in-person verification is required prior to granting access

test_desc: Signed electronic records shall contain information associated with the signing in human-readable format
test_rationale: Signed electronic records shall contain information associated with the signing in human-readable format

test_desc: Multi-factor authentication methods are used in accordance with organizational policy, (e.g., for remote network access)
test_rationale: Multi-factor authentication methods are used in accordance with organizational policy, (e.g., for remote network access)

test_rationale: Electronic signatures and handwritten signatures executed to electronic records shall be linked to their respective electronic records

test_desc: Users who performed privileged functions (e.g., system administration) use separate accounts when performing those privileged functions
test_rationale: Users who performed privileged functions (e.g., system administration) use separate accounts when performing those privileged functions

test_desc: Automated systems deployed throughout the organization's environment are used to monitor key events and anomalous activities
test_rationale: Automated systems deployed throughout the organization's environment are used to monitor key events and anomalous activity, and analyze system logs, the results of which are reviewed regularly.

test_desc: Monitoring includes inbound and outbound communications and file integrity monitoring
test_rationale: Monitoring includes inbound and outbound communications and file integrity monitoring

test_desc: All applicable legal requirements related to monitoring authorized access and unauthorized access attempts are met
test_rationale: All applicable legal requirements related to monitoring authorized access and unauthorized access attempts are met

test_rationale: The information system is able to automatically process audit records for events of interest based on selectable criteria

test_rationale: The organization monitors the information system to identify irregularities or anomalies that are indicators of a system malfunction or compromise and help confirm the system is functioning in an optimal, resilient and secure state.

test_desc: Auditing and monitoring systems employed by the organization support audit reduction and report generation
test_rationale: Auditing and monitoring systems employed by the organization support audit reduction and report generation

test_rationale: Alerts are generated for technical personnel to analyze and investigate suspicious activity or suspected violations

test_desc: Automated systems are used to review monitoring activities of security systems (e.g., IPS/IDS) and system records on a daily basis, and identify and document anomalies
test_rationale: Automated systems are used to review monitoring activities of security systems (e.g., IPS/IDS) and system records on a daily basis, and identify and document anomalies

test_rationale: Unauthorized remote connections to the information systems are monitored and reviewed at least quarterly, and appropriate action is taken if an unauthorized connection is discovered

test_desc: Monitoring includes privileged operations, authorized access or unauthorized access attempts, including attempts to access deactivated accounts, and system alerts or failures
test_rationale: Monitoring includes privileged operations, authorized access or unauthorized access attempts, including attempts to access deactivated accounts, and system alerts or failures

test_rationale: The organization shall periodically test its monitoring and detection processes, remediate deficiencies, and improve its processes

test_desc: Information security aspects of business continuity
test_rationale: Information security aspects of business continuity are (i) based on identifying events (or sequence of events) that can cause interruptions to the organization's critical business processes (e.g., equipment failure, human errors, theft, fire, natural disasters acts of terrorism); (ii) followed by a risk assessment to determine the probability and impact of such interruptions, in terms of time, damage scale and recovery period; (iii) based on the results of the risk assessment, a business continuity strategy is developed to identify the overall approach to business continuity; and (iv) once this strategy has been created, endorsement is provided by management, and a plan created and endorsed to implement this strategy.

test_desc: The organization identifies the critical business processes requiring business continuity
test_rationale: The organization identifies the critical business processes requiring business continuity

test_desc: Business continuity risk assessments
test_rationale: Business continuity risk assessments (i) are carried out annually with full involvement from owners of business resources and processes; (ii) consider all business processes and is not limited to the information assets, but includes the results specific to information security; and (iii) identifies, quantifies, and prioritizes risks against key business objectives and criteria relevant to the organization, including critical resources, impacts of disruptions, allowable outage times, and recovery priorities.

test_desc: The organization media registration, restrictions and protection
test_rationale: The organization, based on the data classification level, registers media (including laptops) prior to use, places reasonable restrictions on how such media be used, and provides an appropriate level of physical and logical protection (including encryption) for media containing covered information until properly destroyed or sanitized.

test_desc: The organization protects and controls media containing sensitive information during transport outside of controlled areas
test_rationale: The organization protects and controls media containing sensitive information during transport outside of controlled areas

test_rationale: The organization restricts the use of writable removable media and personally-owned removable media in organizational systems

test_desc: Anti-virus and anti-spyware are installed, operating and updated on all end-user devices

Server environments for which the server software developer specifically recommends not installing host-based anti-virus and anti-spyware software may address the requirement via a network-based malware detection (NBMD) solution.

test_desc: Access to network equipment is physically protected
test_rationale: Access to network equipment is physically protected

test_rationale: The organization reviews the information system within every three hundred and sixty- five (365) days to identify and disables unnecessary and non-secure functions, ports, protocols, and/or services

test_rationale: The organization disables Bluetooth and peer-to-peer networking protocols within the information system determined to be unnecessary or non-secure

test_rationale: The organization limits authorization to privileged accounts on information systems to a pre-defined subset of users

test_rationale: The organization audits the execution of privileged functions on information systems and ensures information systems prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions

test_rationale: The activities of privileged users (administrators, operators, etc.) include the success/failure of the event, time the event occurred, the account involved, the processes involved, and additional information about the event

test_rationale: Logs of messages sent and received are maintained including the date, time, origin and destination of the message, but not its contents

test_rationale: All disclosures of covered information within or outside of the organization are logged including type of disclosure, date/time of the event, recipient, and sender

test_desc: Storing and protecting the backups at the remote location

test_desc: Inventory records for the backup copies, including content and current location, are maintained
test_rationale: Inventory records for the backup copies, including content and current location, are maintained

test_desc: Maintaining the integrity and security of the backup copies

test_desc: Covered information is backed-up in an encrypted format to ensure confidentiality
test_rationale: Covered information is backed-up in an encrypted format to ensure confidentiality

test_desc: The organization performs incremental or differential backups daily and full backups weekly to separate media

test_rationale: The organization tests backup information following each backup to verify media reliability and information integrity, and at least annually thereafter

test_desc: Backup copies of information and software are made and tests of the media and restoration procedures are regularly performed at appropriate intervals
test_rationale: Backup copies of information and software are made and tests of the media and restoration procedures are regularly performed at appropriate intervals

test_desc: Automated tools are used to track all backups
test_rationale: Automated tools are used to track all backups

test_rationale: Formal agreements with external information system providers include specific obligations for security and privacy

test_desc: The contract with the external/outsourced service provider includes the specification that the service provider is responsible for the protection of covered information shared

test_rationale: The organization requires external/outsourced service providers to identify the specific functions, ports, and protocols used in the provision of the external/outsourced services

test_rationale: Exceptions to the traffic flow policy are documented with a supporting mission/business need, duration of the exception, and reviewed at least annually; traffic flow policy exceptions are removed when no longer supported by an explicit mission/business need.

test_desc: Remote devices establishing a non-remote connection are not allowed to communicate with external (remote) resources
test_rationale: Remote devices establishing a non-remote connection are not allowed to communicate with external (remote) resources

test_desc: The ability of users to connect to the internal network is restricted
test_rationale: The ability of users to connect to the internal network is restricted using a deny-by-default and allow-by-exception policy at managed interfaces according to the access control policy and the requirements of clinical and business applications.

test_desc: Access to the organizations information and systems by external parties
test_rationale: Access to the organizations information and systems by external parties is not permitted until due diligence has been conducted, the appropriate controls have been implemented, and a contract/agreement reflecting the security requirements is signed acknowledging they understand and accept their obligations.

test_desc: Remote access connections between the organization and external parties are encrypted
test_rationale: Remote access connections between the organization and external parties are encrypted

test_desc: Access granted to external parties is limited to the minimum necessary and granted only for the duration required
test_rationale: Access granted to external parties is limited to the minimum necessary and granted only for the duration required

test_desc: The identification of risks related to external party access takes into account a minimal set of specifically defined issues
test_rationale: The identification of risks related to external party access takes into account a minimal set of specifically defined issues

test_desc: The organization obtains satisfactory assurances that reasonable information security exists across their information supply chain
test_rationale: The organization obtains satisfactory assurances that reasonable information security exists across their information supply chain by performing an annual review, which includes all partners/third party-providers upon which their information supply chain depends.

test_desc: Due diligence of the external party includes interviews, document review, checklists, certification reviews (e.g. HITRUST) or other remote means
test_rationale: Due diligence of the external party includes interviews, document review, checklists, certification reviews (e.g. HITRUST) or other remote means

test_desc: Cloud service providers design and implement controls to mitigate and contain data security risks
test_rationale: Cloud service providers design and implement controls to mitigate and contain data security risks through proper separation of duties, role-based access, and least-privilege access for all personnel within their supply chain.

test_desc: The organization monitors for all authorized and unauthorized wireless access to the information system
test_rationale: The organization monitors for all authorized and unauthorized wireless access to the information system and prohibits installation of wireless access points (WAPs) unless explicitly authorized in writing by the CIO or his/her designated representative.

test_desc: The organization describes the groups, roles, and responsibilities for the logical management of network components and ensures coordination of and consistency in the elements of the network infrastructure
test_rationale: The organization describes the groups, roles, and responsibilities for the logical management of network components and ensures coordination of and consistency in the elements of the network infrastructure

test_desc: Wireless access points are placed in secure areas and shut down when not in use (e.g. nights, weekends)
test_rationale: Wireless access points are placed in secure areas and shut down when not in use (e.g. nights, weekends)

test_desc: The organization builds a firewall configuration to restrict inbound and outbound traffic to that which is necessary for the covered data environment
test_rationale: The organization builds a firewall configuration to restrict inbound and outbound traffic to that which is necessary for the covered data environment

test_desc: The organization ensures information systems protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information, including during preparation for transmission and during reception
test_rationale: The organization ensures information systems protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information, including during preparation for transmission and during reception

test_desc: The organization builds a firewall configuration that restricts connections between un-trusted networks and any system components in the covered information environment
test_rationale: The organization builds a firewall configuration that restricts connections between un-trusted networks and any system components in the covered information environment; and any changes to the firewall configuration are updated in the network diagram.

test_desc: Authorizing connections from the information system of one organization to the information systems outside of the organization
test_rationale: The organization (i) authorizes connections from the information system to other information systems outside of the organization through the use of interconnection security agreements or other formal agreement; (ii) documents each connection, the interface characteristics, security requirements, and the nature of the information communicated; (iii) employs a deny all, permit by exception policy for allowing connections from the information system to other information systems outside of the organization; and (iv) applies a default-deny rule that drops all traffic via host-based firewalls or port filtering tools on its endpoints (workstations, servers, etc.), except those services and ports that are explicitly allowed.

test_desc: The router configuration files are secured and synchronized
test_rationale: The router configuration files are secured and synchronized

test_desc: Access to all proxies is denied, except for those hosts, ports, and services that are explicitly required
test_rationale: Access to all proxies is denied, except for those hosts, ports, and services that are explicitly required

test_desc: Authoritative DNS servers are segregated into internal and external roles
test_rationale: Authoritative DNS servers are segregated into internal and external roles

test_desc: The organization ensures the security of information in networks, availability of network services and information services using the network, and the protection of connected services from unauthorized access
test_rationale: The organization ensures the security of information in networks, availability of network services and information services using the network, and the protection of connected services from unauthorized access

test_desc: Identify and authenticate devices on local and/or wide area networks, including wireless networks
test_rationale: To identify and authenticate devices on local and/or wide area networks, including wireless networks, the information system uses either a (i) shared known information solution or (ii) an organizational authentication solution, the exact selection and strength of which is dependent on the security categorization of the information system.

test_desc: Usage restrictions and implementation guidance are formally defined for VoIP, including the authorization and monitoring of the service
test_rationale: Usage restrictions and implementation guidance are formally defined for VoIP, including the authorization and monitoring of the service

test_desc: The organization formally manages equipment on the network, including equipment in user areas
test_rationale: The organization formally manages equipment on the network, including equipment in user areas
